summary: This is an email from an NY CART Coordinator providing a status update on the forensic extraction of data from electronic devices, specifically Mac computers, related to the Epstein case. The sender reports on hours worked and progress made, indicating an ongoing digital evidence collection effort.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator
persons.context: The sender of the email, reporting on progress in extracting data from electronic devices (Macs) for the investigation.

events.title: Forensic Data Extraction Work
events.description: The NY CART Coordinator worked 5 hours on data extraction from electronic devices.

events.title: Continued Forensic Data Extraction
events.description: The NY CART Coordinator worked another 3 hours on data extraction.

events.title: Ongoing Forensic Data Extraction
events.description: The NY CART Coordinator worked from 9 AM, reporting successful exports from 41 items with 8 problematic Macs remaining.

keyFacts: An NY CART Coordinator was actively conducting forensic data extraction from electronic devices as of October 2020.
The extraction process involved at least 49 items, with 41 successfully processed and 8 remaining Mac computers described as 'problematic'.
The work required significant hours over a weekend, indicating the scale and priority of the digital evidence collection.
The document is subject to a protective order, restricting the disclosure of certain paragraphs.
The correspondence is part of an evidence tracking system, indicated by the EFTA reference numbers.
